university_name: Texas A&M University at College Station

Akhil Datta-Gupta.title: University Distinguished Professor
research_areas: Dr. Datta-Gupta has research interests in rapid flow simulation techniques, reservoir optimization, large-scale parameter estimation via inverse methods and uncertainty quantification/ assessments.
Inverse modeling and multi-scale data integration
Modeling and scale-up of enhanced oil recovery

A. Daniel Hill.title: Professor
research_areas: Dr. Hill has five patents in oil recovery and well injection processes, and is recognized as an industry expert in the areas of production engineering, well completions, well stimulation, production logging, and complex well performance (horizontal and multilateral wells). He has presented lectures and courses and consulted on these topics throughout the world.

Nayef Alyafei.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Multi-phase flow in porous media research, mainly on spontaneous imbibition and wettability studies
Capillary trapping phenomena on both the macro and micro scales

Berna Hascakir.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Heavy oil and oil shale recovery with enhanced oil recovery methods
Hot fluid injection; steam/hot water/hot gas flooding, steam assisted gravity drainage (SAGD), cyclic steam injection (CC)
Chemical/Thermal EOR applications: solvent flooding, solvent-steam injection, solvent-SAGD, surfactant flooding, surfactant-steam injection, surfactant-SAGD
Thermal Stimulation: Electrical, Microwave, and Radio Frequency heating
Diagnostic studies on reservoir rock and fluids
X-ray computed tomography, X-ray diffraction (XRD), fourier transform infrared (FTIR), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS)
Analyze reaction kinetics with thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) and differential scanning calorimetry (DSC)

Charles H. Bowman.title: Professor Emeritus of Petroleum Engineering and Dean Emeritus of Texas A&M University Qatar

Christine Ehlig-Economides.title: Professor Emeritus of Petroleum Engineering
research_areas: Dr. Ehlig-Economides is internationally recognized for her expertise in reservoir engineering, pressure transient analysis, integrated reservoir characterization, complex well design, and production enhancement.

W. David Kennedy.title: Professor of engineering practice
research_areas: Numerical modeling of logging instrument responses

Ding Zhu.title: Professor
research_areas: distributed temperature and acoustic measurement and interpretation
optimization of well performance by downhole flow control equipment

Eduardo Gildin.title: Associate Professor
research_areas: Model reduction of large scale dynamical systems
Control and optimization of large scale dynamical systems
Closed-Loop Reservoir Management: Production Optimization, History Matching and Optimal Control

George Moridis.title: Professor
research_areas: Visiting Senior Scientist and Faculty Associate in the Energy Geosciences Division of the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory (LBNL);
ExxonMobil Chair Professor for in the Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering, National University of Singapore;
Visiting Professor in the Guangzhou Center for Gas Hydrate Research of the Chinese Academy of Sciences;
Adjunct Professor in the Chemical Engineering Dept. at the Colorado School of Mines; and
Adjunct Professor in the Petroleum and Natural Gas Engineering Dept. of the Middle East Technical University, Ankara, Turkey.
He is in charge of the Hydrocarbon Resource Program at LBNL, and is in charge of research programs on unconventional resources, including gas hydrates.

Dominique Guerillot.title: Professor
research_areas: Thermodynamical, geochemical and transport phenomena applied to improved oil and gas recovery processes, CO2 sequestration and natural gas storage
Numerical methods and application of computing

George Voneiff.title: Professor of Engineering Practice
research_areas: Applied petroleum economics in unconventional plays
Statistical analysis of large datasets from unconventional formations
Large-Scale production data analysis using empirical techniques

Hadi Nasrabadi.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Compositional modeling of multiphase/multicomponent fluid flow in porous media
Modeling asphaltene precipitation in porous media

Hisham Nasr-El-Din.title: Professor
research_areas: Enhancing well performance through chemical means

I. Yucel Akkutlu.title: Associate Professor
research_areas: Shale gas and oil resource assessment and characterization
CO2-enhanced shale gas and oil recovery
Shale oil recovery using surfactants and micro-emulsions
Digital rock physics and pore-network modeling
Compositional reservoir flow simulation coupled with geo-mechanics

J. Bryan Maggard.title: Senior Lecturer
research_areas: Numerical methods and application of computing

John Jochen.title: Senior Lecturer
research_areas: Gas wells, vertical and horizontal, conventional and unconventional (shales)
Single-well production data analysis: analytical and simulation
Production forecasting: decline curve analysis and simulation based

Jihoon Kim.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Coupled flow and geomechanics in hydrate, shale and tight gas, and geothermal reservoirs
Hydraulic fracturing, hydro-shearing, coupled geomechanic-geophysical modeling

Kan Wu.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Coupled geomechanics and fluid flow modeling

Jenn-Tai Liang.title: Professor
research_areas: Using nano drug delivery technologies for transport and controlled release of oilfield chemicals
CO2 injection for carbon sequestration and improved oil recovery

Maria A. Barrufet.title: Professor
research_areas: Multicomponent thermodynamic and transport phenomena in nanoscale pores applied to compositional reservoir simulation
Flow assurance: hydrates and asphaltene prediction and prevention
Desalination processes to treat oilfield brines

Michael King.title: Professor
research_areas: Pressure and rate transient analysis for unconventional reservoirs
Upscaling of geologic models for flow simulation

Marcelo Laprea-Bigott.title: Professor of Engineering Practice
research_areas: Reservoir engineering and production optimization in Venezuelan fields

Nimir Elbashir.title: Professor
research_areas: Dr. Elbashir is the Director of Texas A&M Engineering Experiment Station Gas and Fuels Research Center: a major research center that involves 30 faculty members from both the Qatar and College Station campuses of Texas A&M University. He is also the Chair of the ORYX GTL Gas-to-Liquid Technology Excellence Program.

The focus of his research activities is the design of advanced midstream and downstream natural gas processing units including reactors, catalysts and conversion processes to ultra-clean fuels and value-added chemicals.

Nobuo Morita.title: Professor
research_areas: Geomechanics numerical modeling using the finite and boundary element methods for borehole, perforation, casing, and formation stabilities and hydraulic fracturing

Peter Bastian.title: Professor of Engineering Practice
research_areas: Career reservoir engineer with over 30 years industry experience
Specializing in oil and gas economics

Peter Valk&oacute;.title: Professor
research_areas: Design and analysis of hydraulic fracturing treatments
Numerical inversion of the Laplace transform

A. Rashid Hasan.title: Professor
research_areas: Wellbore Heat transferSystematic modeling of heat transfer in wellbores. Current work plan is to develop heat transfer models for subsea completion in deep water settings.

Transient Transport ProcessesModeling fluid temperature and pressure during shut-in, startup, or rate change is complicated by the coupled nature of these transport processes. We are using numerical and semi-analytical approaches for modeling transient flow of heat, mass, and momentum in wellbores. Future work includes modeling wellbore transient heat transfer to convert wellhead pressure during water injection in unconventional formations.

Wellbore/Reservoir Fluid FlowWe are using an integrated approach to modeling fluid flow and pressure drop in both the reservoir and the wellbore to better understand the process of liquid loading of gas wells and well blow out.

Sara Abedi.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Granular material failure and flow and granular physics

Thomas D. Seers.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Utilization of multimodal and multiscale 3D imaging towards the characterization and modeling of naturally fractured reservoirs
His current work pertains to three key areas:
Use of 4D X-ray tomography (synchrotron source and lab based sources) to reveal the mechanics of multiphase flow and deformation at the pore-scale within faulted and heterogeneous reservoir rocks

Application of close-range remote sensing techniques (unmanned aerial vehicle and terrestrial lidar 3D imaging platforms) towards the characterization and modeling naturally fractured reservoirs of the Middle East (digital outcrop analogues)
Hybrid geomechanical - quasi-genetic modeling of natural fractures and discontinuities within structurally complex hydrocarbon reservoirs

Terri Smith.title: Lecturer
research_areas: Terri Smith's oilfield editing projects include:
IADC Deepwater Well Control Guidelines, 1st edition (editor)
Petroleum Engineering Handbook, Vol 2: Drilling Fluids Chapter (editor)
Editorial assistance with industry response during 2010 BP Macondo crisis – Equipment Committee
International tender response projects for multiple oilfield disciplines
White papers on unconventional resources and deepwater drilling topics
Numerous SPE and industry technical papers and articles

Sam Noynaert.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Automation and optimization of the drilling process
Solutions to drilling-related problems in unconventional reservoirs

Jeff Spath.title: Professor
research_areas: Analytical simulation and pressure transient techniques.

Yuefeng Sun.title: Professor
research_areas: poroelasticity, mechanics and electrodynamics of multiphase fractured porous media
Core-log-seismic-electromagnetic integration for reservoir description – Deep/frontier exploration, enhanced oil/gas recovery, carbon sequestration, and unconventional resources

Thomas A. Blasingame.title: Professor
research_areas: Specialized analysis techniques for well test and production data
Software for the analysis, interpretation, and modeling of well test and production data
Rate-time (decline curve) analysis for unconventional reservoir systems
Rate-time-pressure analysis for unconventional reservoir systems
Performance analysis of tight gas/shale gas reservoir systems
Completion production correlation studies (correlation of performance with completion parameters)

William D. McCain, Jr..title: Visiting Professor
research_areas: Production of volatile oils and gas condensates

Yuhe Wang.title: Assistant Professor
research_areas: Reservoir simulation and high performance computing
Stochastic reservoir modeling and uncertainty quantifications
